citation.article-title: Transfer of Methanogenium bourgense, Methanogenium marisnigri, Methanogenium olentangyi, and Methanogenium thermophilicum to the genus Methanoculleus gen. nov., emendation of Methanoculleus marisnigri and Methanogenium, and description of new strains of Methanoculleus bourgense and Methanoculleus marisnigri.

p.s: Methanoculleus (Me.tha.no.cul´le.us. M. L. n. methanum, methane; Gr. n. culleus, bag; M. L. masc. n. Methanoculleus, methane[-producing] bag)
Species are irregular coccoids which form methane from H2-CO2, from formate, and sometimes from alcohols.
Cells are 1 to 2 μm in diameter and occur singly or in pairs.
Some cells appear to have flagella, but motility has not been observed.
Cells have a protein cell wall which is sensitive to lysis by detergents; cells stain gram negative.
The G+C content of the DNA is 54 to 62 mol%.
The type species is Methanoculleus bourgense comb. nov.
